tool_input.prompt:
Test the changes made to the dashboard in the admin portal. Verify that:
- Total proxies shows all proxies (including disabled)
- Available proxies shows only enabled (not disabled) proxies
- The map and other sections exclude disabled proxies from available counts
- Top performing proxies still filters !disabled
- No errors in console
- Refresh works

Report any issues or confirm success. Use browser or curl if needed, but since it's UI, describe observations.

questions.question: Which Docker mode would you like to start? Choose one: Production (optimized builds, no hot-reload) or Development (hot-reload with debug logging).

options.label: Production
options.description: Start in production mode with docker compose up --build -d

options.label: Development
options.description: Start in development mode with docker compose -f docker-compose.yml -f docker-compose.dev.yml up -d

return (
Total Proxies

{activeLeases}

tool_input.new_string:
return (
  <Card>
    <CardHeader>
      <CardTitle>Proxy Statistics</CardTitle>
    </CardHeader>
    <CardContent>
      <ResponsiveContainer width="100%" height={300}>
        <BarChart data={barData}>
          <XAxis dataKey="name" />
          <YAxis />
          <Tooltip />
          <Bar dataKey="value">
            {barData.map((entry, index) => (
              <Cell key={`cell-${index}`} fill={entry.color} />
            ))}
          </Bar>
        </BarChart>
      </ResponsiveContainer>
    </CardContent>
  </Card>
);

todos.content: Fix type import for NotificationConfig in Settings.tsx

tool_input.old_string: setNotificationConfigs(prev => prev.map(c => c.method === method ? { ...c, ...updated } : c) as NotificationConfig[]);
tool_input.new_string: setNotificationConfigs(prev => prev.map(c => c.method === method ? { ...c, ...(updated as Partial<NotificationConfig>) } : c));
